intro: Heracleum kansuense, commonly known as the Chinese cowparn. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, pinnately divided leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. It is native to China and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Heracleum kansuense is often found in mountainous regions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
